criteria: Identification of Healthy Expressions of Affection
descriptions: The student fails to list any healthy ways to express affection, love, friendship, or concern.
The student lists one unhealthy way to express affection, love, friendship, or concern.
The student lists one healthy way to express affection, love, friendship, or concern.
The student lists two healthy ways to express affection, love, friendship, or concern, but they are basic and lack detail.
The student lists three or four healthy ways to express affection, love, friendship, or concern with some detail.
The student lists five or more healthy ways to express affection, love, friendship, or concern with detailed explanations and examples.
The student does not demonstrate an understanding of what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy'.
The student demonstrates a limited and/or incorrect understanding of what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy'.
The student uses only broad and poorly-explained criteria of what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy'.
The student explains what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy', but the explanation is missing criteria.
The student adequately explains what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy'.
The student clearly and comprehensively explains what makes an expression of affection, love, friendship or concern 'healthy', going beyond the course material.
The student's list lacks variety and includes inappropriate expressions.
The student's list lacks variety and/or includes inappropriate expressions.
The student's list has limited variety and/or includes expressions that may be questionable in certain contexts.
The student's list demonstrates some variety, with most expressions being appropriate.
The student's list demonstrates good variety and appropriateness in different situations.
The student's list demonstrates exceptional variety, showing a nuanced understanding of appropriate expressions in diverse contexts.
